t: The Fool Says, There Is No God
The*pn fool says in his heart, “There is no God.” They*ld are corrupt, they do abominable deeds; there*ld is none who does good.
The*pn Lord*s looks down from heaven on the children of man, to*ld see if there are any who understand, who*ld seek after God.
They*pn have all turned aside; together they have become corrupt; there*ld is none who does good, not*ld even one.
Have*pn they no knowledge, all the evildoers who*ld eat up my people as they eat bread and*ld do not call upon the Lord?*s
There*pn they are in great terror, for*ld God is with the generation of the righteous.
You*ln would shame the plans of the poor, but*ld the Lord*s is his refuge.
Oh,*pn that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion! When*ld the Lord*s restores the fortunes of his people, let*ld Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.
